questions.question: The variety of life within a specific habitat or ecosystem is...

choices.answer: watershed
biodiversity
dead zone
food web

questions.question: Which is an example of a biotic factor that could affect the stability of an ecosystem?

choices.answer: Hurricane
Drought
Algae
Heat Wave

questions.question: For an ecosystem to remain stable it most likely has what?

choices.answer: A high level of biodiversity
More predators than prey
Biotic factors decrease
Finite resources decrease

questions.question: What results from cutting down a rain forest and planting agricultural crops?

choices.answer: A decrease in biodiversity
An increase in the amount of energy recycled
A decrease in erosion
An increase in biodiversity

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an invasive species?

choices.answer: Deer
Freshwater Fish
Hawks
Zebra Mussels

questions.question: Rabbits eat weeds. If the rabbit population decreases, what will happen to the weed population?

choices.answer: The weed population will remain the same
The weed population will increase
The weed population will also decrease
The weed population will become extinct

questions.question: Which activity would reduce biodiversity in a forest ecosystem?

choices.answer: Replacing bees that are naturally found in that area
Protecting wildflowers from logging activities
Replacing harvested trees with young trees
Clearing a large area and planting a field of coffee plants

questions.question: Which human activity will most likely have a NEGATIVE affect on global stability?

choices.answer: Decreasing water pollution levels
Increasing recycling programs
Decreasing habitat destruction
Increasing world population growth

questions.question: Salting roads causes salty streams.  This situation best illustrates what?

choices.answer: The influence of humans is always negative in the long term
The influence of humans causes unpredictable negative impact
Human alteration does not need to be studied
Human alteration will cause pollution and loss of resources

questions.question: Why is human impact often more dramatic than the impact of other living things?

choices.answer: Humans' need large quantites of water
Humans' need a variety of food
Human's ability to adapt to change
Humans' ability to alter the environment in many ways

questions.question: Which is a result of human activities?

choices.answer: Decay on leaves in a forest adds to soil fertility
Acid rain in an area kills fish in a lake
Ecological succession following volcanic activity
Natural selection on an island change gene frequencies

questions.question: How do greenhouse gases impact an ecosystems' biodiversity?

choices.answer: Causes global warming which is harmful to arctic predators
Causes smog in the air which is harmful to birds
Causes salty streams which is harmful to freshwater fish
Causes urban heat island which is harmful to humans

questions.question: How does building cities impact an ecosystems' biodiversity?

choices.answer: Causes salty streams with is harmful to freshwater fish
Causes urban heat island which is dangerous for humans
Causes global warming witch is harmful to artic predators
Causes smog in the air which is harmful to birds

questions.question: How does artificial light impact an ecosystems' biodiversity?

choices.answer: Repels animals away from artificial light sources
Causes smog in the air which is harmful to birds
Causes global warming which is harmful to arctic predators
Attracts and interferes with natural processes of animals

questions.question: Which is a possible solution to increased salt levels in urban streams?

choices.answer: Heating the roads during the winter
Use sand instead of salt for friction
Plow more, salt less
All of the above
